item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "<b>Faith, n.</b> Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "There is no God and we are his prophets." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Being a Humanist means trying to behave decently without expectation of rewards or punishment after you are dead." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "You're on Earth. There's no cure for that." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Atheism is a non-prophet organization." -- George Carlin

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "In the dark times Will there also be singing? Yes, there will also be singing. About the dark times." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Military intelligence is a contradiction in terms." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "The Church says: the body is a sin. Science says: the body is a machine. Advertising says: The body is a business. The Body says: I am a fiesta." -- Eduardo Galeano

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Religion is an illusion and it derives its strength from the fact that it falls in with our instinctual desires." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "In dark ages people are best guided by religion, as in a pitch-black night a blind man is the best guide; he knows the roads and paths better than a man who can see. When daylight comes, however, it is foolish to use blind, old men as guides." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Daniel Charms
item.description: "Is there anything on earth which would have meaning and would even change the course of events not only on earth, but in other worlds?” I asked my teacher. “There is,” my teacher answered me. “Well, what is it?” I asked. “It’s...” began my teacher and suddenly fell silent. I stood and waited intently for his answer. But he was silent. And I stood and was silent. And he was silent. And I stood, silent. And he was silent. We’re both standing and silent. Ho-la-la! We’re both standing and silent. Ho-le-le! Yes, yes, we’re both standing and silent! 16-17 July 1937" -- Daniel Charms

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "It is the job of thinking people not to be on the side of the executioners." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ronan Noane add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "It has yet to be proven that intelligence has any survival value." -- Arthur C. Clarke
